JobFullDesc:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back. 
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.”
The American Express Global Consumer Services Technologies (GCST) team leads delivery of pivotal initiatives for the US Consumer and OPEN businesses.
We are seeking an experienced Quality Assurance Engineer and team leader with test strategy and automation experience to join our team in Phoenix. Our Quality Engineers understand that “good enough” is never enough. They strive for the highest levels of quality and the most efficient methods to achieve it. They are specialists in testing strategies, tooling, and execution.
This position suits someone who wastes no time forming working relationships quickly and add value by introducing the best test practices and techniques learned from rich experience.
We have the opportunity to engage on pivotal initiatives that are core to the growth of American Express. Truly a pivotal experience!
As a Quality Engineer on our team, you’ll:

Maintain and Execute test strategies, plans and artifacts with internal and external partners
Build and use a deep understanding of the products and technology assets being tested to ensure efficient test coverage
Partner with engineers application architects and environment operations on test infrastructure design
Work with software, infrastructure, and software engineers to deliver target code quality
Work with Product Owners and Release Train Engineers to review test scenarios, validate test results and maintain documentation
Track quality metrics that can be collated and reported to management. Identify patterns and opportunities from the metrics to drive innovation and improvement
Offer guidance to engineering teams including driving improvements in automation and testing in a Continuous Delivery/Continuous Integration (CD/CI) environment
Find opportunities to embrace innovative testing technologies and techniques

“Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.” 
Skills & Qualifications:


Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other similar field, and/or equivalent work experience required; advanced degree preferred
2+ years of proven skills in quality and test engineering with ability to create test data, write test cases, running functional, automated, and/or performance tests, and leading defect resolution
Testing experience will span multiple domains such as mainframe, mid-range, web, mobile and customer service UX.
Experienced knowledge of platform delivery methodology (Agile, incl Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, Test Driven Development (TDD), Behavior Driven Development (BDD) and Waterfall)
Ability to work with a number of Quality scanning tools, be able to baseline and track on-going quality metrics, and display via Dashboards and to interpret the data to drive the changes needed
Any of the following test certifications - QAI, ASQ, IIST, ISEB, ISTQB - are a plus
Experienced knowledge of continuous integration (CI), continuous deployment(CD) and continuous testing (CT) capabilities, including tools such as Jenkins, ARA, Rally and/or JIRA, version control such as GIT or SVN and service virtualization
Leadership skills, professional presence, very strong interpersonal skills and ability to influence without direct authority
